author: Daniel Pearson
title: BAPEâ€™s Latest Collection Riffs On Thrasherâ€™s Flame Logo
text:
After months of furor surrounding the appropriation of Thrasher magazineâ€™s iconic flame logo by high street fashion brands, streetwear label BAPE has just unveiled its own cheeky interpretation.
The â€œFlame Teeâ€ collection comprises of three T-shirt styles â€” a flaming BAPE, a flaming Baby Milo, and a flaming BAPE logo â€” with each available in black or white. The graphics can hardly be described as blatant copies (unlike the ones released by H&M, see below) but the inspiration is clear.
Just got a letter back from @hm's lawyers. Here's an excerpt from their response. FUCK OFF H&M ğŸ–•ğŸ¾ Respect the original ğŸ”¥ 
A post shared by THRASHER MAGAZINE (@thrashermag) on Feb 16, 2017 at 2:45pm PST 

BAPEâ€™s â€œFlame Teeâ€ collection drops this Saturday, March 25 at BAPE locations and online . Each tee is priced at Â¥6,800 JPY (approximately $61).
Plagiarism isnâ€™t the only thing getting Thrasher â€˜s back up â€” earlier this year, the magazineâ€™s editor-in-chief, Jake Phelps, took umbrage with Justin Bieber and Rihanna wearing its clothing .
If you just canâ€™t get enough of Thrasher -inspired clothing, check out this drug-fueled brand putting Mexico City on the streetwear map.
